column1: Common Bond Bistro & Bakery - Montrose////You basically stand in line and choose what pastries you want which are nicely displayed along the counter in front of you. I had to refrain from ordering the enter menu and decided on the almond and chocolate croissants to share
column3: and the veal sandwich for the bf. You're supposed to pay for your meal and then find a table but most people just grab a table first because they're hard to come by. I don't think there are enough tables to accommodate how many patrons come through this place however the staff is very helpful in finding you a table. We sat down and a waiter brings you your order. I shouldn't actually use the word waiter because you have to get your own utensils
